administrators called to car parts supplier .
stratford man died 'going into water after dog ' .
john lewis boss confirmed as mayoral candidate .
ryder cup : andy sullivan tees off .

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: that marks the end of our updates for another week .
please join us from 08:00 on monday for more news , sport , travel and weather - and keep an eye out here for breaking news during the evening .

documents.title: mark venus takes up 'difficult ' challenge with sky blues
text: sky blues caretaker manager mark venus says the club 's position at the bottom of the table is a `` difficult but exciting '' challenge .
the first-team squad is finalising preparations for tomorrow 's league one fixture at port vale after the departure of manager tony mowbray yesterday .
the club 's in a `` transition '' at the moment , venus said , and `` we 're obviously in the position where we need to start up points '' .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: leamington man who tried to hide searching for indecent images avoids jail
text: a leamington man who shut himself in his room for 24 hours a day using indonesian words to search for indecent images of children has avoided jail .
author: Leamington Spa Courier

documents.title: on midlands today : room shortage at university of warwick
text: dozens of students at the university of warwick are being forced to share single bedrooms or stay in hotels due to a shortage of accommodation .
around 120 new undergraduates , who arrived at the university this week , were told they 'd be living with strangers as there simply was n't enough room .
the university says the provision is being given a discounted rate , and single rooms will be found for everyone eventually .
you can see my report on midlands today at 18:30 on bbc one .
author: Joan Cummins
Midlands Today reporter

documents.title: england rugby : eddie jones calls up eight wasps players
text: the uncapped nathan hughes ( dan robson and sam jones are among eight wasps players included in an england 45-man elite performance squad selected by eddie jones .
all three will attend a training camp in brighton next month as will joe launchbury , tommy taylor and elliott daly .
while matt mullan is named in the wider squad , he is not going to camp .
james haskell will attend but will not train as he continues his recovery from the toe injury that finally gave up on him in the second-test win against australia this summer .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: wasps netball completes superleague team
text: wasps netball have completed their squad recruitment ahead of the new netball superleague season with the signing of lucy parize ,
the 18-year-old from sutton coldfield plays goal attack or goal shooter and joins from the west midlands warriors in the netball performance league .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: video : your weekend weather
text: some clear spells this evening , but then showery rain arriving from the southwest .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: 'cash flow difficulties ' led to covpress administration
text: the administrators for coventry car parts manufacturer covpress said they were appointed on 29 september because of `` cash flow difficulties '' .

joint administrators eddie williams , richard lewis and david dunckley of business and finance adviser grant thornton said : despite significant investment in the operations the business experienced cash flow difficulties for a number of months which led to requests for further funding and support from shareholders .

`` this cash position worsened during september and despite additional support from the customers , the business did not have sufficient funding available which would allow the business to continue to trade . ''

documents.title: man appears in court on murder charge
text: man appears in court on murder charge

documents.title: service loss fear amid council 's £ 36m spending gap
text: coventry city council faces a £ 36m gap between its income and its spending plans by 2020 , according to auditors .

a report by the council 's executive director of resources warns that as a result it is `` inevitable '' that areas not previously considered for savings will now need to be reviewed , with some services being `` delivered differently or quite possibly not at all '' .
author: Shelley Phelps
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire, Political Reporter

documents.title: gordon released by warwickshire
text: gordon released by warwickshire

documents.title: john lewis boss chosen as conservative mayor candidate
text: john lewis boss andy street will leave the department store chain after being chosen to run as the conservative candidate for west midlands mayor .
mr street was formally selected by local party members to fight the election in may next year .
he has handed in his resignation at john lewis and will leave within a month , a member of his team said .

labour 's candidate is siôn simon , an mep for the west midlands , while beverley neilsen , a former chief executive of the heart of england tourist board , has been chosen as the liberal democrats ' candidate .

documents.title: covpress analysis : an 'unusual ' administration
text: the administration of coventry car parts manufacturer covpress is unusual .
it is very different from many collapses we have seen in the past where companies have lacked orders and struggled to win new work .
covpress has been expanding rapidly over the last three years and is understood to have full order books .
whatever has gone wrong , i would expect administrators would be seeing a lot of interest from potential buyers and that should help save the bulk of the jobs at covpress .
author: Peter Plisner
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: travel : delays on the m42
text: there are problems on the m42 in warwickshire southbound between junction 10 .
there 's been a vehicle fire .
one lane is now open and highways england says it hopes traffic conditions will have returned to normal by 17:15 .
traffic has been temporarily stopped on the # m42 s/b btwn j10 - j9 due to a car fire .
@ twitterid on scene
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: katharine merry says time is right in race for 2026 commonwealth games
text: the former olympic sprinter katharine merry says it is `` about time '' birmingham and the west midlands hosted a multi-sport event as it bids to host the 2026 commonwealth games .
she said : `` we 've been accused of dropping behind sheffield and manchester in terms of our sporting prowess , which i would challenge because of the amount of international competitions we have .

`` this is exciting , we really really are ready for it , the infrastructure we have in place across birmingham and the west midlands is second to none , we 're 30m ahead of the rest of the field already . ''

documents.title: police seek man after rugby robbery
text: police have released a cctv image of a man they 'd like to speak to in relation to an alleged robbery in the market hall area of rugby .
the incident happened in a store in the clocktower shopping centre on the afternoon of friday 9 september .

documents.title: covpress workers remain hopeful despite company going into administration
text: workers at covpress remain hopeful the firm can have a bright future despite going into administration .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: coventry council says grammar school plan does n't make the grade
text: concerns about proposals to re-introduce grammar schools have been raised by coventry city council .

councillor kevin maton , in charge of education , said the council would oppose the `` imposition of this unnecessary throwback from the past '' , a system , he said , that was `` unfit to meet the needs of 21st century coventry '' .
he said a comprehensive eduction based on a broad curriculum was the best way to `` encourage opportunities for every child '' , regardless of their ability .
pm theresa may 's plans for more grammar schools have already triggered an avalanche of criticism .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'one in a million ' : man dies 'going into water after his dog '
text: the holidaymaker who died in the sea in cornwall has been named locally as trevor priest , 63 , from near stratford-upon-avon .
a lifeboat crew pulled him from the sea after he 's thought to have gone into the water after his dog .
he died later in hospital , said police .
juliet short wrote on facebook : `` trevor was one in a million never a bad word or an unhappy face . ''
sharon barrett wrote : `` your warmth , sincerity and infectious fun will be greatly missed . ''

documents.title: latest : covpress goes into administration ; man dies in cornish sea

- car parts maker covpress in administration
- stratford holidaymaker dies in cornish sea

documents.title: sullivan makes ryder cup debut
text: nuneaton golfer andy sullivan tees off on his ryder cup debut at 13:50 with rory mcillroy in a foursome against the us pairing of rickie fowler and phil mickelson .
you can follow our ryder cup coverage here .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: `` he was adored and loved by so many '' - friend pays tribute to men killed in crash
text: tributes have been paid to the two young men who died in a car crash in wellesbourne last friday evening .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: premiership : wasps v harlequins team news
text: matt mullan will captain the wasps side against harlequins at the ricoh arena on sunday .
ashley johnson will make his first start of the season at hooker and kearnan myall starts in the second row .
team news : dai young brings in @ twitterid @ twitterid & @ twitterid v @ twitterid at the @ twitterid on sunday -
game day # coyw @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid

author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: union pushes for talks over covpress administration
text: the unite union says it 's requesting urgent talks with covpress after the company went into administration yesterday .
regional officer adrian ross said the move was a `` worrying development '' for the 800 employees involved and `` more generally for the west midlands economy '' .
`` we will have a clearer of what is happening , once talks with the company have concluded , '' he said .
administrators grant thornton have reassured the workforce that there will be no redundancies and the factory is operating as normal .

documents.title: former olympic sprinter katharine merry speaks of wider benefits of commonwealth games bid
text: former olympic bronze medalist katharine merry has said if birmingham were successful in winning its bid for the 2026 commonwealth games it could have wider benefits for the west midlands .

the former birchfield harrier said : `` there 's so many reasons , the amount of visitors that could come , the amount of money that could come into the city and the surrounding areas , the amount of jobs it can create , there 's so many positive things - now is our time .
`` for glasgow it generated nearly £ 400m , scotland as a whole , knocking on nearly £ 800m .
`` the emphasis is n't just on birmingham , its the surrounding areas too , for example we could use the ricoh arena in coventry . ''

documents.title: car parts maker put into administration
text: car parts maker put into administration

documents.title: cornwall holidaymaker and dog died in sea
text: a holidaymaker from warwickshire and his dog have died after getting into difficulty in the sea in cornwall .
a lifeboat crew pulled the 63-year-old man from the water near tintagel in cornwall .
the man , who is thought had gone into the water after his dog , died in hospital , said police .
it happened on tuesday afternoon near dunderhole point , said port isaac rnli , which carried out the rescue attempt .

documents.title: men arrested following assault in warwick
text: witnesses are being sought following an assault in warwick .
the victim , a man , was cycling passed two men on emscote road around 7.30pm on september 26 when they threw what is believed to be a bottle at him .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: coventry could benefit from commonwealth games bid
text: birmingham 's bid to host the 2026 commonwealth games will benefit the whole of the region , say organisers .
the city 's council has launched a feasibility study and claimed the event could generate more than £ 390m for the region .
events could take place at coventry 's ricoh arena , along with villa park , the alexander stadium , edgbaston cricket ground , the nec and the genting arena .
candidates have to notify their intention to bid by march 2018 , and the winner will be announced in november 2019 .

documents.title: latest round of county council savings could see jobs and services lost
text: on our front page this week : already stretched services could be lost completely on the back of huge council budget cuts .
author: Stratford Observer

documents.title: police investigate fatal m6 crash
text: warwickshire police are appealing for help in working out how a lorry driver died in a four-vehicle crash on the southbound m6 .
it happened at around 09:30 yesterday morning between junction four and corley services .
two cars and two lorries crashed and the driver of one of the trucks died .
detectives say they want to find out how each vehicle was being driven before the collision .
author: Paul Marriott
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: former sky blues boss eric black named in corruption claims
text: former coventry city manager eric black gave undercover reporters advice on how to bribe officials at other clubs , the daily telegraph has claimed .
black , 52 , was filmed apparently naming staff at other clubs who could be induced to pass on information about players to a company for money .
such payments would be against fa rules .
black , southampton assistant manager , has denied the allegations .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: speeding driver caught doing 135 miles per hour
text: police pulled over a driver on the m6 last night traveling at nearly double the national speed limit .
more than 2,000 drivers were caught doing over 100 miles an hour on the uk 's roads last year .
driver reported for summons # m6 at corley , recorded speed 135mph .
court file being completed .

documents.title: watch : latest weather for the west midlands
text: a mix of sunshine and showers with the risk of hail and thunder and highs of 15c ( 59f ) .
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: covpress calls in administrators
text: there are fears for 800 jobs at a coventry engineering firm that has called in administrators .
covpress , based in canley , makes body panels for jaguar land rover and renault among others , and exports parts across the world .
administrators grant thornton say they were called in because of `` urgent funding issues '' .
author: Richard Williams
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: travel : m42 accident
text: an earlier accident involving two vehicles is causing problems on the m42 southbound between j4 ( a34 ) and j3a .
travel is reporting congestion to j6 , a45 ( birmingham airport ) .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning from coventry and warwickshire live
text: welcome to friday 's news , sport , travel and weather updates .
comment on our stories and send us your over email , twitter or our facebook page .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: that 's all from us here in the local live team on thursday .
join us from 08:00 tomorrow for another mix of news , sport , travel and weather updates - and keep an eye out here for breaking news during the evening and overnight .

documents.title: coming up on tv
text: a court has heard how a teenager ran for his life after being shot at close range .
prosecutors say 18-year-old kenichi phillips collapsed and died after being left for dead in an alleyway .
we hear more from the case .

we speak to a scientist who began her career researching ways of helping patients with cancer by boosting their immune systems after treatment , before she was herself diagnosed with hodgkins lymphoma .
and i interview cricketer jonathan trott as he tells the story of his struggle with stress and anxiety which led to his withdrawal from the ashes tour of 2012/13 .
join us for the midlands today on bbc one at 18:30 .
author: Nick Owen
Presenter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: work begins on international furniture manufacturer 's hq in leamington
text: work has begun on the construction of the new production building and headquarters for british furniture manufacturer vitsœ on the site of the former ford foundry in leamington .
author: Kenilworth Weekly News

documents.title: heritage walkway `` stopped '' by student digs plan
text: planning permission has been given to build 200 student rooms in a new three , five and six-storey building at the old dairy crest site on harper road , coventry .
st michael 's ward councillor , david welsh , who spoke against the application , said the decision would `` stop any idea of a heritage walkway for the public '' in the area .
another application for a 100-bed student accommodation at west orchard house , corporation st , was unanimously refused .
the proposals were found to have been `` poorly designed '' because they had no provision for a residential walkway .
author: Shelley Phelps
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire, Political Reporter

documents.title: man knocked off his bike and kicked in warwick assault
text: a man was knocked off his bike and kicked by two men during an assault in warwick on monday september 26 .
author: Warwick Courier

documents.title: video : latest weather forecast
text: some isolated showers during the evening , but otherwise dry and clear tonight with lows of 10c ( 50f ) .
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: burglar jailed after leaving blood at crime scenes
text: a `` clumsy '' burgler who left his blood at the scene of two crimes has been jailed for more than five years , police said today .
francis cawley , 22 , from hill top in nuneaton , admitted offences including burglary , vehicle theft , and fraud and was sentenced to five years and eight months in prison at warwick crown court .
police say he was trapped by his dna when he cut himself hurling a concrete block through a glass door and again when he smashed a van window to steal power tools in birmingham .

documents.title: tony mowbray reaction : 'worst day for the club ''
text: former sky blues captain reda johnson tweets :

BBC Local Live

documents.title: sky blues first team coach leaves
text: coventry city has announced first-team coach jamie clapham has left the club with `` immediate effect '' .
in a statement the club thanks him for `` all his hard work '' over the past 14 months and says nicky eaden will assume coaching responsibilities .

documents.title: one lane opens on m6 after crash
text: one lane of the m6 southbound has re-opened after an earlier fatal crash at j3a .
travel reports serious congestion in the area .
we 've re-opened the # m6 s/bound , j4 - j3 , following the earlier collision between 2 cars and 2 hgvs .
one lane now open , but delays remain .

documents.title: latest : sky blues manager resigns ; club 's free condoms 'not safe for sex '
text: these are some of our headlining stories today :
- tony mowbray resigns as coventry manager
- nightclub freshers ' week condoms 'unsafe '
- cameroon asylum row man 'told to prove he is gay '
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cameroon asylum row man 'told to prove he is gay '
text: an asylum seeker says he `` lived in fear '' and had to hide who he was when he lived in cameroon .
valerie ediage has had an asylum application turned down and says , as a gay man , his life would be at risk if he returned to the african nation .
homosexuals in the country can be jailed for up to five years .
the 30-year-old said he moved to the uk to escape persecution over his sexuality and now lives in west bromwich with his partner , who is also from cameroon but has been granted uk residency .
the home office has declined to comment specifically on the case but said asylum applicants needed to show they faced persecution .
mr ediage volunteers at a support group for gay people in coventry and says he has supplied evidence including intimate photographs with his partner and support letters from gay friends .
he said : `` '' they [ the home office ] say i have n't given them sufficient evidence but i have given them everything . ''

documents.title: jlr crash victim will be `` missed every minute of every day ''
text: a motorcyclist who died in a crash on the lode lane jaguar land rover factory site in solihull on monday has been named as kieren rowe .
the 23-year-old , who died at the scene , was described by his parents as a `` loving , caring , witty lad , with an amazing personality and huge heart '' .
they said `` we are devastated `` that `` our beautiful boy was tragically taken away from us '' and `` he will be missed every minute of every day '' .
a statement from jlr said it was working `` closely with the authorities '' to look at how the crash , on monday afternoon , occurred .
mr rowe was an employee of a supplier to the site .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : latest weather forecast
text: some sunny spells this afternoon , but feeling breezy with highs of 17c ( 63f ) .
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: lorry driver dies in m6 crash
text: a lorry driver has died .
in a multi-vehicle crash on the southbound m6 .
the ambulance service says it was called at around 09:25 after two hgv 's and two cars were in collision near junction 3a for the m6 toll .
the driver of one of the lorries died at the scene , the other truck driver was n't hurt .
two men in one of the cars were treated at the scene for minor injuries and the driver of the second car - an elderly man - escaped injury .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: reaction to tony mowbray 's departure
text: portsmouth player and former sky blues captain carl baker tweets his reaction to the departure of manager tony mowbray .
just seen mowbray has gone .
ca n't say i 'm surprised after the start cov have made to the season so far .
shame to see such a big club in this state .

documents.title: jaguar 'wo n't be moving production outside uk ' post-brexit
text: jaguar land rover 's motto when it comes to brexit is `` keep calm and carry on '' , says sales chief andy goss .
the firm exports 80 % of its cars , so a weaker pound could help .
it has car plants all over the world - but `` would n't be moving production outside of britain '' .
`` we build cars in brazil , china , india , and we 're going to build cars in slovakia and frankly we will not be put off our stride by this [ brexit vote ] .
our plants in the uk are effectively working five days a week , 24 hours a day , and we 're going to continue that success story , without a doubt . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: proud parents to watch andy sullivan make his ryder cup debut
text: the parents of andy sullivan describe his debut at the ryder cup as a `` dream come true '' .
terry and sue sullivan have left nuneaton for america to watch andy play for europe against the united states .
only five years after turning professional , andy sullivan is now ranked in the world 's top 50 .

documents.title: sky blues : chesterfield tie postponed
text: nothing to do with the departure of manager tony mowbray , but coventry city say their league home tie with chesterfield has been moved due to the away side 's international engagement .
it says more information about the fixture will be released soon .

documents.title: mowbray resignation : his time in management
text: mowbray 's first managerial appointment was as caretaker boss with ipswich town following george burley 's departure in october 2002 .
he then got his first big chance in scotland in may 2004 with hibernian , where he was a relative success ; his side having won more than half their games under him .
he returned to england with west bromwich albion in october 2006 , replacing bryan robson , leading the baggies to the championship title in 2008 .
albion were relegated from the premier league a year later and mowbray left to join celtic .
mowbray spent just nine months in charge in glasgow , being sacked in march 2010 .
seven months later , he rejoined his boyhood club middlesbrough , with whom he had spent the majority of his playing career .
he was there for three years , enjoying a best-placed finish of seventh in the championship in 2012 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: m6 crash : traffic allowed past collision
text: here 's the latest on this morning 's m6 crash that caused casualties - closing the southbound carriageway .
traffic stuck at the scene is now being allowed past the collision closing # m6 s/b j4 to j3 .
diversion details here

documents.title: club 's free condoms 'not safe for sex '
text: club 's free condoms 'not safe for sex '

documents.title: 'unsafe ' condoms handed out to students
text: the sexual health service in coventry is warning that some condoms being handed out to students at bars and clubs in the city are for `` promotional purposes '' and are n't safe to be used .
it says the condoms do n't feature safety markings and `` may fail when used '' .
charlotted hubbard from coventry sexual health service said : `` we are encouraging everyone to always check their contraception for the safety marks .
they are there for a reason '' .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakingmowbray resigns as coventry manager
text: breakingmowbray resigns as coventry manager

documents.title: six injured in m6 crash
text: the ambulance service says it 's treating six patients at the scene of a `` serious '' multi-vehicle crash on the m6 .
the southbound carriageway remains closed between j3a , m6 toll and j3 , a444 ( nuneaton ) .
we are currently in attendance at a serious collision on the m6 sbound between jncs 3a & 3 .
motorway closed sbound , please avoid the area .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mowbray 's reign at the ricoh arena
text: former hibernian , west bromwich albion , celtic and middlesbrough manager mowbray has been in charge of city since succeeding steven pressley in march 2015 .
mowbray kept city up on the final day , then actually took them top of league one for a fortnight in november 2015 .
that was fuelled by the goals of on-loan duo adam armstrong , from newcastle , and norwich city 's jacob murphy .
but they both stopped scoring and the sky blues then fell away out of promotion contention to 13th , before rallying to finish eighth .

after another frustrating summer in the transfer market , against the backdrop of continued protests from fans against the club 's owners , sisu , city have so far struggled , scoring just six goals from six draws in 10 games to sit bottom of league one .

documents.title: sky blues trust : club 's 'dreadful plight ' rests with owners
text: coventry city supporters group the sky blue trust says it 's `` sad '' to see the departure of tony mowbray from the football club .
mowbray resigned as manager this morning and the trust said `` he led us through an exciting season in 2015/16 - the most enjoyable for city fans in many years '' .

in a statement the trust said : `` most of the responsibility for our dreadful plight rests with the owners of the club - sisu - and we believe it is they that should now be considering their position following their comprehensive mismanagement of our club '' .
`` we therefore reiterate that sisu should follow mowbray 's honourable lead and put the club up for sale . ''

documents.title: tony mowbray resignation : club thanks for outgoing boss
text: in a statment coventry city said : .
`` we would like to thank tony for all his energy and dedication over the past 18 months .
we would also like to wish tony all the very best for the future and put on record that he will always be welcome at the football club . ''

documents.title: asylum row man 'told to prove he is gay '
text: asylum row man 'told to prove he is gay '

documents.title: body cameras for all west midlands police officers
text: body cameras are going to be given to all west midlands police response officers by the end of next month .
it comes as a new study suggests it leads to a drop in complaints made against forces .
det chief supt chris todd says the west midlands was part of research led by cambridge university , which encouraged them to make this decision .
the year-long study found the use of body-worn cameras sees complaints against police `` virtually vanish '' and involved 2,000 officers across uk and us forces .

the findings suggested the introduction of wearable cameras led to a 93 % drop in complaints made against police by the public - suggesting , the report said , that cameras resulted in behavioural changes that `` cool down '' potentially volatile encounters .
author: Louise Hancock
Newsreader, BBC WM

documents.title: tony mowbray resigns
text: coventry city say that without a win in the first ten league games `` tony felt on a professional level that he was no longer able to take the club forward '' .
the 51-year-old yorkshireman , who succeeded the sacked steven pressley , said after last night 's 2-2 draw with afc wimbledon : `` the table does n't lie .
it 's embarrassing to go 10 games without a win . ''

documents.title: travel : serious crash closes m6 southbound
text: police say a 'serious ' collision has closed the m6 southbound between junctions 4 and 3 .
diversions are in place .
# m6 # warwickshire - southbound closed between j4 and j3 while we assist emergency services with a serious collision .
expect delays

documents.title: breakingcoventry city manager tony mowbray steps down
text: sky blues boss tony mowbray has stepped down as manager of the sky blues after 18 months in charge .
the former celtic boss , who took city to the top of league one just 10 months ago , had been in charge since march 2015 and kept the club in the third tier on the final day of last season .

documents.title: jaguar wants 'tariff-free ' eu access
text: jaguar land rover has given a strong warning on brexit , saying tariffs in europe could mean job losses here - and europe is the car maker 's biggest market .
at the paris motor show , andy goss , jlr 's global sales operations director , said : `` europe is extremely important .
europe 's about a fifth of our sales .
it 's a critical market for jlr .
we 'd like to have a tariff-free environment so we can continue to sell .
we 'd actually like to also attract the best labour on an ongoing basis . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: latest : tony mowbray close to quitting ; jlr issues brexit warning
text: these are some of our main stories today :
- coventry city manager close to quitting after winless league run
- tarrifs in europe could lead to job losses , says jaguar land rover
- body cameras to be issued to all west midlands police response officers
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: jlr launches new discovery
text: twenty-seven years after the model was launched , jaguar land rover has revealed its latest discovery .
it was unveiled here in the west midlands during an event that featured a world record for lego-building - with the vehicle driving over a plastic brick version of london 's tower bridge .

documents.title: tony mowbray : coventry city manager close to quitting after winless league run
text: manager tony mowbray says he wo n't be a `` burden '' to the sky blues and `` wo n't be around too long if we 're not winning '' .
despite rescuing a draw with fellow strugglers afc wimbledon , bottom-side city are three points adrift , having failed to win in 10 league one games .
`` let 's see what the next few hours days bring , '' mowbray said .
`` the table does n't lie .
it 's embarrassing to go 10 games without a win , '' he added after the draw .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: video : latest weather forecast
text: rain should fizzle out leaving some brightness and a few sunny spells with highs of 17c ( 63f ) .
author: Lucy Martin
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning from coventry and warwickshire live
text: welcome to thursday 's news , sport , travel and weather updates .
comment on our stories and send us your over email , twitter or our facebook page .

BBC Local Live

documents.title: coventry city 2-2 afc wimbledon
text: coventry city 2-2 afc wimbledon
author: Ged Scott
BBC Sport at the Ricoh Arena

text: st mary 's , ilmington

text: midlands questions to prime minister

Political editor, Midlands

documents.title: good evening from local live
text: that 's all from us on wednesday .
please join us again from 08:00 on thursday for more news , sport , travel and weather updates and keep an eye out here for any news that breaks this evening .

documents.title: coming up on tv
text: two teenagers have been arrested in connection with an attack on a girl in tamworth , after footage was shared over social media .
new figures show the number of motorists stopped by police in the west midlands for using their mobile phones has fallen dramatically .
we investigate why .
and paralympian and three times wimbledon wheelchair tennis champion , jordanne whiley , has .
up another accolade today - closer to home .
join us for more on these stories and others on the midlands today on bbc one at 18:30 .
author: Mary Rhodes
Presenter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: latest : police investigations continue into sexual assault in coventry park ; sky blues trust claim jimmy hill 's widow backs their campaign
text: your headlines tonight :
- police investigations are continuing into reports that a man`s been sexually assaulted in a park in coventry .
- the sky blue trust says jimmy hill 's widow has given her blessing for fans groups to use his name in their campaign to call for the club 's owners to sell-up .
- plans have been unveiled for a new motorway services to be built on the m6 near rugby .

documents.title: new land rover discovery launched later
text: the brand new land rover discovery is being unveiled in the midlands later .
the discovery was first introduced in 1989 and this is the third generation of the model..
it 's being made in solihull and will cost around £ 45,000 .
i 'll report from the launch for the midlands today from 18:30 on bbc one .
author: Peter Plisner
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: watch : police catch hgv driver on mobile
text: the driver of a 44-tonne truck was among motorists caught using their mobile phone as the bbc joined central motorway police on patrol .
it comes as data shows the number of motorists stopped across the country has almost halved in five years .
the national police federation said the drop was due to fewer traffic officers .
under new rules expected to come in next year , drivers will get six points on their licence and face a £ 200 fine .

documents.title: city explorer aims higher than just the summit of everest for latest mission
text: a coventry-based explorer is hoping to reach out to one million youngsters while climbing the world 's tallest mountain to raise awareness about the impact of climate change .
author: Coventry Observer

documents.title: tuc expresses concerns over planned cuts to coventry 's libraries and museums
text: the tuc has raised concerns about proposed cuts to the libraries and museums in coventry .

the midlands tuc creative & leisure industries committee ( clic ) says it aims to campaign in support of arts and leisure provision across the region and for an improvement in the terms and conditions of workers in the sector .
the group is also concerned at the timing of the cuts when coventry is bidding to become city of culture 2021 .
libraries in caludon castle , cheylesmore , coundon , earlsdon and finham are under threat because of the need to save nearly £ 4m .
the council says `` savage '' central government cuts to local authority budgets have forced its hand .
author: Shelley Phelps
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire, Political Reporter

documents.title: consultation over £ 500,000 cuts to services
text: plans to cut services have been put forward by warwickshire county council .
it says it need to cut £ 478,000 from its budget and needs to make £ 261,000 from the heritage & culture sector in particular .
the proposals made are in response to significant economic pressure affecting the county council as a whole .
this decision was not taken lightly and the proposals put forward will enable the stabilisation and future prosperity of heritage and culture warwickshire . ''
the consultation finishes on 31 october .

documents.title: multimillion-pound windfall for birmingham from edgbaston hosting 2017 tournament
text: a £ 25.3m windfall will come to birmingham 's economy as edgbaston cricket ground hosts five of the fixtures during the .
icc champions trophy 2017 , a new study says .

marketing birmingham regional observatory has carried out the research on the impact of warwickshire 's home ground hosting four matches in the group stages and one of the semi-finals of the competition between the top eight-ranked international sides .
neil snowball , chief executive of edgbaston stadium , said : `` we expect all five games to be sell-outs and attract more than 120,000 spectators to birmingham across the tournament . ''
the fixtures edgbaston will host during the competition running from 1-18 june include england v australia , india v pakistan , australia v new zealand and pakistan v south africa .

documents.title: weather : how is the rest of the day looking ?
text: rebecca wood has your forecast .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: tougher enforcement needed on student anti-social behaviour , says taskforce
text: tougher enforcement is needed to tackle anti-social behaviour by students living in shared houses , according to a warwick district council taskforce .
anti-social behaviour powers could be used to issue warnings and formal notices , potentially leading to prosecutions , the interim report recommends .
the process should be applied `` to landlords as well as tenants , where appropriate '' , .
the report adds .
the district has around 300 licensed houses of multiple occupation ( hmos ) - houses where three or more adults from different families rent a property - and over 900 unlicensed ones .
meg bond , who lives in radford road , leamington spa , told the bbc she knew of families who had moved out of the area because of the problems they faced .
author: Shelley Phelps
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire, Political Reporter

documents.title: new service station proposed for m6 outside of coventry
text: moto hospitality ltd , britain 's biggest service area operator , is hoping to build the new site at junction 1 of the m6 .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: queen elizabeth hospital 'feels pressure of worcestershire downgrade '
text: the queen elizabeth hospital in birmingham is under `` significant '' pressure due to downgraded health services in worcestershire , a trust boss says .
neonatal and children 's inpatient services have moved from the alexandra hospital in redditch to the worcestershire royal and some accident and emergency services have also been transferred .

university hospitals birmingham chief executive dame julie moore has said they are being directly affected by the changes - with an increase in demand for the emergency department at the qe and more patients choosing to receive their care there too .
hospital bosses in worcestershire refute the claims .

documents.title: campaigners to try to save children 's services at the alexandra hospital
text: campaigners are holding a meeting tonight to vent their frustration at the withdrawal of children 's services at the alexandra hospital .
members of the `` save the alex '' group will question health service managers at the town hall in redditch .
the hospital says it withdrew the service because of staff shortages .

documents.title: your questions : coventry & warwickshire
text: have you got a question about coventry & warwickshire ?
is there something you have seen or heard that you would like us to investigate ?
it could be a burning issue or something you have always wondered about the area or its people .
send us your questions here .
we could be in touch and your question could make the news .
author: Jennifer Meierhans
BBC News Online

documents.title: latest : coventry police investigate sexual assault ; campaigners meeting to fight plans to close childrens services at the alexandra
text: your headlines this lunchtime :
- police in coventry are investigating reports a man has been sexually assaulted in charterhouse field off the london road .
- warwick district council is looking at setting up a task force to deal with anti-social behaviour by students living in shared houses .
- campaigners against the closure of children 's services at the alexander hospital are meeting later to vent their frustration

documents.title: air ambulance finds a unique way of raising money .
text: the charity behind warwickshire and northamptonshire 's helicopters has turned to online auction sites to make the most of its high value donations .
volunteers separate out donated clothes and goods that could sell on online sites .
donors to the hidden gems campaign will receive a certificate and the chance to see the air ambulance and its base at close up .
author: James Roberson
Reporter, East Midlands Today

documents.title: your an amazing sunset
text: thanks to our viewers for sharing their of last night 's sunset with us - we 'll have more of your on midlands today at 13:30 .
author: John Bray
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: police tape off coventry park after a man was sexually assaulted
text: the attack happened in charterhouse fields , off london road , last night .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: a new `` endangered '' species gorilla born at twycross
text: a western lowland gorilla has been born at twycross zoo .
the new arrival 's yet to be named but is the third arrival for parents 22-year-old mother ozala and 24-year-old father oumbi .
with the species on the endangered list , the birth 's been welcomed by conservationists at the zoo .
author: Philip Churm
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: new figures show that the number of drivers stopped for using their mobiles has fallen dramatically ; campaigners against the closure of children 's services at the alexandra hospital meet tonight .
text: your headlines this morning :
- new figures show the number of motorists stopped by the police in the west midlands for using their mobile phones has fallen by almost 60 % over the past five years .
- campaigners are holding a meeting tonight to vent their frustration at the withdrawal of children 's services at the alexandra hospital .
- a task force set up by warwick district council says that tougher enforcement is needed to tackle anti-social behaviour by students living in shared houses .
author: Paul Marriott
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: fewer drivers on mobile phones 'caught by police '
text: the number of drivers caught using a mobile phone behind the wheel has almost halved in five years , the bbc can reveal .
some 178,000 people were stopped in 2011-12 by police in the uk , compared with under 95,000 last year .
the west midlands has seen a drop of nearly 60 % in that time .
the national police federation said the drop was due to fewer traffic officers .
but police say tougher new sentences will help discourage drivers using their phones .

documents.title: union accuses coventry university of 'shameful ' tactics
text: unions leaders representing lecturers employed by a coventry university subsidiary company , have accused bosses of using `` shameful '' tactics to avoid dealing with trade unions .
around 70 english language teachers recently gained union recognition from their employer , cu services ltd , a university subsidiary .
according to the union , 40 temporary staff have now been told they can only carry on working if they become agency workers for another university-owned company where the ucu is not recognised .
ucu general secretary , sally hunt said this was a `` shameful episode '' and the action 's of coventry 's university subsidiary company were an `` embarrassment to the sector '' .
their fixed contracts [ at cu services ] had expired .
the opportunity was offered for new roles in the autumn term with thefutureworks .
these new contracts have improved terms - including a contract completion payment and a 1.1 % pay rise - with no changes to sick pay and holiday .

documents.title: new service station proposed for m6 outside of coventry
text: more than 200 new jobs could be created with the construction of a new motorway services at junction one of the m6 .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: watch : latest weather forecast for the west midlands
text: a fairly bright day ahead and while at times it will be quite cloudy , there will also be some very pleasant sunny spells and highs of 20c ( 68f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: birmingham airport reveals plan for £ 100m investment
text: birmingham airport is to spend £ 100m on new baggage handling systems and car parks .
bosses want to upgrade the baggage screening systems so they can double the speed luggage can be processed .
they also want to create two new car parks including a new drop-off car park - free for 30 minutes - with a covered walkway to the terminal entrance .
author: David Lumb
BBC News Online

documents.title: travel : m6 northbound delays
text: there 's stationary traffic on the m6 northbound between j3 for nuneaton and the m6 j3a for the m6 toll because of an accident and a rolling roadblock , drivers are warned .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning from local live for coventry and warwickshire
text: welcome back to wednesday 's news , sport , travel and weather updates .
comment on our stories and send us your over email , tweet us or visit our facebook page .

text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: video : latest weather forecast
text: a dry night with clear spells and light winds with lows of 12c ( 54f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: on midlands today : celebrating coventry 's elephants
text: birmingham has its bull , warwickshire has its bear and coventry has plenty of elephants .
join me on midlands today at 18:30 to find out why the animal has such strong links to the city , and how they 're being celebrated this week .
how many elephants are really living in # coventry @ twitterid @ twitterid

documents.title: latest : remains confirmed as newborn baby ; and sky blues fans agree series of protests
text: here 's a recap of our main stories today :
- police confirm bedworth remains belong to newborn baby
- coventry city fans agree series of protests against club owners
- stiliyan petrov offered nuneaton coaching role
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: calls for m6 to be taken into public ownership
text: the question of a free m6 toll has been resurrected - this time in a city a little further north .

labour 's candidate for the west midlands metro mayor , mep sion simon , has told delegates at the party 's conference in liverpool that he ca n't see why it should n't be taken into public ownership for the benefit of the region .

of course we know the possibility of making the road free was being discussed in the very early days of a devolution deal for the west midlands , a move that unsurprisingly did n't make the final george osborne cut .
but many have spoken about a possibly £ 2bn benefit to the local economy if the congestion through the m6 bottleneck could be eased .
and now a certain toll road happens to be up for sale .
it looks like the subject could be back on the table as we head towards a metro mayoral election next may .
author: Kathryn Stanczyszyn
Political Reporter, BBC WM

documents.title: railway remains 'are newborn baby '
text: railway remains 'are newborn baby '

documents.title: sky blues fans to boycott rochdale game ?
text: dan pallett
dan pallett
they have a plan .
the sky blues fans who met last night will march ahead of rochdale game and then boycott it # pusb
they have a plan .

documents.title: investigation launched into jlr crash death
text: police say they 'll be working with the health and safety executive to investigate the death of a 23-year-old motorcyclist at the jaguar land rover factory site in solihull .
the 23-year-old died after a collision with a manufacturing tractor unit and trailer on a private road , inside the factory site .

documents.title: coventry city fans agree series of protests against club owners
text: sky blues fans have agreed to stage a series of protests as they back a campaign calling for the club 's owners sisu to sell up and go .
an umbrella meeting of supporter groups , including the sky blue trust , .
agreed a march to the ricoh arena should be organised along with a boycott of one game and a walk-out at another .
the action 's in support of a petition being raised by the coventry telegraph calling for coventry city to be put up for sale .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: birmingham airport invests £ 100m on infrastructure
text: birmingham airport says it 's investing £ 100m on improvements including hold-baggage screening , self-service check-in and additional car parking .
a new drop-off car park - free for 30 minutes - .
is planned along with upgrades to existing parking .
the `` ambitious '' plan is to double the number of self-service bag drop kiosks and improve the digital check-in process .

documents.title: three teenagers arrested in connection with cawston arson attack
text: three teenagers have been arrested and bailed in connection with an arson attack at a park in cawston earlier this month .
author: Rugby Advertiser

documents.title: petrov offered nuneaton coaching role
text: petrov offered nuneaton coaching role

documents.title: alton towers operator fined over smiler crash
text: the operator of the alton towers theme park - merlin attractions - has been fined a record five million pounds after admitting health and safety breaches which led to a rollercoaster crash

reference was made in court to previous convictions against merlin , which included a fine of £ 350,000 issued at warwick crown court in april 2012 after the death of a person at warwick castle , over a separate health and safety breach .
the previous conviction involved failure to carry out a sufficient risk assessment .
words , the judge said , `` should have been ringing in the ears '' when they opened the smiler .

documents.title: police confirm bedworth remains belong to newborn baby
text: warwickshire police say the remains recovered near queen street in bedworth last wednesday belong to a newborn baby .
claire cook , aged 24 , from bedworth , pleaded guilty to concealing a birth and has been released on bail .
james hamshaw , aged 23 , of no fixed address , also pleaded guilty to concealing a birth and has been remanded in custody .
both are due to appear at warwick crown court on 14 october .

documents.title: west midlands rovers vs manchester united ?
text: how would you like to see a 'west midlands rovers ' football team competing with the likes of manchester united and liverpool ?
that 's the idea coming from siôn simon , the labour party candidate hoping to become the first west midlands 'metro ' mayor .
the former minister said birmingham 's international reputation has been damaged by the lack of a leading football club .
he said it is unfortunate there is not a `` west midlands rovers '' or a `` super premium global football brand '' that could attract fans in china .

documents.title: motorists prosecuted for driving too close to cyclists
text: fourteen motorists will receive prosecution notices for driving too close to cyclists .
the central motorway police group tweets the drivers were given the notices this week .
motorists who drive too close to cyclists as they overtake are being targeted by west midlands police officers on bikes .
cyclists should be given at least the same space as vehicles , widely considered to be 1.5m ( 4.9ft ) , and offending drivers risk prosecution .
14 drivers receiving prosecution notices this week for close pass offences committed on our regions roads # givespacebesafe # safercycling
did they opt our of `` chat in the back of the car '' option or was driving so poor they were n't offered that option ?
ps good going
no these are straight prosecutions from 3rd party camera footage following complaints from cyclists .

documents.title: stiliyan petrov could join nuneaton town ?
text: nuneaton town can provide stiliyan petrov `` valuable coaching experience '' if he takes up an offer from the club , says manager kevin wilson .
the 37-year-old former aston villa player has been offered the chance to join the club as player coach after recovering from leukaemia , which forced him out of the game four years ago .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: dog microchips : outdated contact details leave animals unclaimed
text: nearly 1,000 stray dogs in the midlands could not be reunited with their owners last year due to outdated microchips , kenilworth animal charity dogs trust has said .
the charity found 6,667 dogs were left unclaimed in kennels between april 2015 and march 2016 .
one in eight were pets that could not be returned as their microchips had not been updated by their owners , it said .
in april , it became a legal requirement for all pet dogs to be microchipped with current contact details .

documents.title: road closed for police inquiries
text: edmund road in foleshill closed in both directions between the b4113 foleshill road junction and the lewis road junction , because of a police incident .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: motorcyclist dies after crash at jlr site
text: a man has died after he was involved in a crash at the the jaguar land rover ( jlr ) plant in solihull .
a statement from jlr says the man was an employee of one of their suppliers , and are working `` closely with the authorities '' to look at how the crash , on monday afternoon , occurred .
the motorcyclist somehow collided with a hgv at the plant .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: banking fraud and corruption trial starts
text: the trial has started of six people , including michael bancroft from shipston-on-stour , accused of fraud and corruption involving a department of the halifax bank of scotland ( hbos ) .
he , along with david mills , mark dobson , alison mills , jonathan cohen and tony cartwright .
have pleaded not guilty .
southwark crown court was told that the six were involved in a racket led by another man , lynden scourfield .
the six defendants are charged with six counts of conspiracy to corrupt , fraudulent trading and conspiracy to conceal criminal property .

documents.title: police launch murder inquiry after death of coventry man
text: two people have been arrested on sus of murder after a man was found dead .
the 47-year-old was foundat an address in foleshill , coventry , after police were called to reports of a man collapsed .
two men , aged 42 and 43 , who were at the address , have been arrested and police say the death is being treated as sus
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: motorcyclist injured in crash with people carrier
text: a motorcyclist suffered potentially serious head injuries after a crash with a people carrier in coventry , say the ambulance service .
it happened at the junction of ansty road and hall lane , close to the city 's university hospital , this morning .

documents.title: coventry man who hid car involved in road race death of bedworth girl facing jail
text: a man who helped to hide one of the cars involved in a road race that claimed the life of bedworth teenager lucy commins is behind bars .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: jeetan patel : warwickshire spinner wins most valuable player award for second time
text: warwickshire off-spinner jeetan patel has won the professional cricketers ' association ( pca ) most valuable player award for a second time .
patel , 36 , took 102 wickets in all formats for the bears in 2016 , which included 69 in the county championship .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: latest : rugby 's local plan and lack of student accommodation ; and

- rugby mp calls for more consultation time on local plan
- university of warwick students complain about 'lack of accommodation '
- two die in wellesbourne road crash

documents.title: travel : accident partially blocking ansty road
text: an accident is partially blocking the a4600 ansty road in coventry at the b4082 woodway lane junction .
ansty road at the junction of woodway lane outbound is still down to 2 lanes open .
police are in attendance .
approach with caution .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: two die in wellesbourne road crash
text: two men have died in a crash near wellesbourne .
the men , aged 25 and 30 , were in a car which collided with another car near the kingsmead crossroads on friday evening .
police are appealing for witnesses .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: marcus willis pays visit to warwick school
text: wimbledon star marcus willis paid a visit to warwick school .
the 25-year-old was joined by fellow warwick boat club tennis coach gavin henderson to talk to year seven pupils about the sport .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: call for more consultation time on 'complex ' local plan
text: more time is needed to consult on rugby 's local development plan , the town 's mp says .
the document sets out the council 's housing and employment provision and is open for consultation until 11 november .
mp mark pawsey says he 's written to the council asking for that time frame to be doubled to 12 weeks .
it is a substantial document in its own right but it also draws heavily upon other similarly lengthy and complex , inter-related documents .
as such it is only right that local residents should be given more time to study in detail the intricacies of each piece of work and comment on them . ''

documents.title: video : latest weather forecast
text: a mainly dull , cloudy and overcast day with some light spots of drizzle possible before something a little brighter towards the end of the afternoon .
highs of 19c ( 66f )

BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: good morning from coventry and warwickshire live
text: welcome to tuesday 's news , sport , travel and weather updates .
you can contact us and share your by twitter or reach us on our facebook page .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: the local live team is back from 08:00 with more news , sport , travel and weather , but keep an eye out here for breaking news during the evening and into the morning .
have a great evening .

documents.title: red arrows pilot death : ejector seat firm to be prosecuted
text: an ejector seat company is to appear in court accused of a breach of health and safety law over the death of a red arrows pilot .
flt lt sean cunningham from coventry was injured after being ejected from a hawk t1 jet while on the ground at raf scampton , lincolnshire .
the parachute on his ejector seat did not deploy and the airman later died in hospital .

documents.title: nuj condemns football reporter ban
text: the national union of journalists ( nuj ) has condemned coventry city football club for banning journalists from press conferences because of `` unfavourable coverage of the club owner sisu '' .
coventry telegraph editor , keith perry , said reporters had been `` banned '' from pre-match press conferences while the newspaper continued to call for sky blues ' owners sisu to sell the club .
the nuj trinity mirror group chapel has agreed a motion calling on the club to rescind the decision saying `` journalists carrying out their normal work should not be targetted in this way '' .

chris morley , nuj northern and midlands organiser , said : `` they need to grow up and accept that in a democratic country there is the right to express criticism and that it is unacceptable to shoot the messenger when things are going wrong . ''

documents.title: weather video : what 's this evening got in store ?
text: this evening will be cloudy with occasional outbreaks of rain with lows of 13c ( 55f ) .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: wasps ' james cannon to join connacht
text: wasps has confirmed that lock james cannon is to join connacht rugby this week .
he 's made 93 appearances in six seasons for the side since joining as a 21-year-old .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: latest : firm to be prosecuted over red arrows death ; union condemns reporter ban
text: here 's a recap of our main stories today :
- red arrows pilot death : ejector seat firm to be prosecuted
- nuj condemns football club for banning journalists from press conferences
- houses earmarked for coventry city football club training ground
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: nuneaton has 'best ' roundabout
text: a traffic island in nuneaton that boasts a `` dandelion fountain '' has been named as uk roundabout of the year .
a of the island will feature in the annual best of british roundabouts calendar - on the `` prestigious '' december page .
president of the uk roundabout appreciation society , kevin beresford , says the roundabout `` sums up what is the epitome of the perfect one-way-gyratory '' .
he added : `` traffic islands do not come much better than this . ''
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: geely auto group backs supersonic bloodhound
text: the chinese owners of coventry car-markers london taxi company have been unveilled as the main sponsor behind the british bloodhound supersonic car project .
geely auto group 's support means the rocket racer now has the financial means to go and break the land speed record next year .
bloodhound 's predecessors thrust2 and thrust ssc live permanently at coventry transport museum .
author: Jonathan Amos
Science correspondent, BBC News

documents.title: drug dealer who used cs gas in coventry skydome attack jailed for five years
text: a young man who used cs spray during an attack at the coventry skydome which led to another man being stabbed has been jailed .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: jeetan patel called up for new zealand test squad
text: warwickshire off-spinner jeetan patel has been recalled to the new zealand test squad against india which resumes on friday .
the 36-year-old , who took 102 wickets for the bears this season , last played for the side in 2013 .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: coventry burglars branded `` scumbags '' after stealing dead man 's wedding ring
text: a grieving widow has been left distraught after burglars stole her late husband 's wedding ring .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: flt lt sean cunningham : firm to be prosecuted over death
text: the health and safety executive ( hse ) says it will be prosecuting ejector seat manufacturer martin baker aircraft ltd for an alleged breach of health and safety law .
red arrows pilot , flt lt sean cunningham , died after his ejector seat initiated during pre-flight checks of his jet when it was on the ground and stationary at lincolnshire airbase , raf scampton .
the hse 's david butter said : `` we have conducted a thorough investigation and consider there is sufficient evidence and it is in the public interest to bring a prosecution '' .

documents.title: breakingprosecution over red arrows death
text: an ejector seat manufacturer is to be prosecuted over the death of a red arrows pilot at raf scampton in 2011 , the health and safety executive says .
flt lt sean cunningham , who grew up in coventry , was ejected while on the ground at the raf base in lincolnshire .

documents.title: coventry and warwickshire : tell us your questions
text: is there something you have seen or heard that you would like us to investigate ?
it could be a burning issue or something you have always wondered about the area or its people .
you can get in touch with us here , and use the tool to send us your question .
author: Jennifer Meierhans
BBC News Online

documents.title: coventry man suffered serious burns in arson attack after landlord failed to install fire alarm
text: a tenant suffered life-threatening burns in an arson attack .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: aldi to redevelop atherstone hq
text: the british arm of aldi says it will invest £ 300m to revamp stores across the country , including a redevelopment of its head office in atherstone .
the german-owned firm said sales had grown by 12 % to £ 7.7bn in 2015 .
it plans to refurbish more than 100 stores and open 70 new uk branches in the next 12 months .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

text: patel wins mvp award for second time

documents.title: opera classes to help vulnerable feel better
text: free weekly classes are being launched for those over the age of 18 suffering from dementia , alzheimer 's and other mental health issues .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: festival of imagineers returns to city
text: a week-long festival of free exhibitions , workshops and activities starts in coventry today .
events for the festival of imagineers take place across the city with a base in the daimler powerhouse , which will be open from 12:00 until 16:00 every day .
the week will also see the launch of `` bridge '' , a 15m ( 49 foot ) structure made out of rolled paper , which will be exhibited in coventry cathedral .
1000 cov school children have contributed to our paper bridge in @ twitterid # festivalofimagineers @ twitterid
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: blaze lose to nottingham panthers
text: the coventry blaze lost 5-3 against the nottingham panthers at the skydome arena last night
the coventry goals were scored by josh godfrey , brett robinson and jordan pietrus .
blaze head coach danny stewart says it 's been a `` disappointing couple of weeks '' .
match report & full reaction : mistakes costly to blaze in panthers defeat
erhhm think you 'll find the score was 3-5
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: five stratford buildings relisted to commemorate 400th anniversary of shakespeare 's death
text: five buildings in stratford have been re-listed to commemorate the 400th anniversary of shakespeare 's death .
author: Stratford Observer

documents.title: sky blues at bottom of the table
text: with no league wins after nine games , coventry city remain at the bottom of the table after being beaten 2-1 by gillingham .
despite an early goal by kytel reid , manager tony mowbray said `` very few '' players `` did enough '' during the match at priestfield .
we did n't do the basics well enough .
disappointing defensively today , we did n't stand up enough to it , and that 's what mainly disappoints me .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

highs of 15c ( 59f ) .

documents.title: latest : plans for housing on sky blues training ground ; aldi hq redevelopment
text: these are some of our main stories today :
- coventry city included in plans for housing redevelopment

- unbeaten wasps top of the premiership table
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live

documents.title: sky blues training ground earmarked for redevelopment
text: coventry city 's training base at ryton has been included in rugby borough council 's local plan as a potential redevelopment site .
the club says it 's worked with the council , sport england and parish councillors to have the site included in the plan , which goes out for public consultation today .

in a statement the club announced intentions to move to a `` new modern site '' which , it said , would act as an `` inspirational environment '' and `` better serve the needs of the football club as a whole '' .
the club also reiterated that the current site could not be redeveloped until it had `` demonstrated to rugby council and sport england '' that an adequate replacement had been found .
author: Moira Rawlings
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: premiership : wasps win puts them top of the table
text: wasps made it four wins from their opening four games to go top of the premiership with victory against northampton .
george north 's second-minute try had given saints the perfect start , but wasps weathered an early onslaught .
jimmy gopperth put them ahead from a superb breakaway try fashioned by the quick thinking of danny cipriani .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: good morning from coventry and warwickshire live
text: welcome to monday 's news , sport , travel and weather updates .
you can contact us and share your by twitter or reach us on our facebook page .
author: Vanessa Pearce
BBC Local Live
